root: ^This is the first part of our cooling system, the Heat Sink!
^It's responsible for seeping the heat generated by the CPU away into large metal pieces, that are then cooled down by fans.
^There is another type of cooling, called "water powered cooling", but it is difficult to maintain, expensive, and overkill for most computers. It's mainly used for high end gaming rigs.
^To install the heat sink, first, apply a special paste called "thermal paste" to the CPU. This paste helps transfer heat more efficiently.
^Only a small amount of paste is needed! Be careful not to use too much or it'll just make a mess!
^Then, the Heat Sink itself is screwed on top of the CPU. Let's give it a try now!
